snippet.title: Suicide Express Longplay (C64) [50 FPS]
snippet.description:
Developed by Antony Crowther and published by Gremlin Graphics in 1985.

Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Al82_Retro
Add me on Google+: http://bit.ly/1tPwL1u

The objective of Suicide Express is to guide your nuclear-powered death-train, the SCHI-PARG, along monorail tracks on the surface of the planet Nilmerg, destroying aliens in a bid to make the planet habitable by humans. Once you reach 100,000 points, your train takes off and heads for the stars, completing the game.

Tony Crowther single-handedly created an incredibly innovative and challenging game early on in the C64's life-cycle. Not only does the player have to watch the top half of the screen to shoot enemies, he/she must also watch the bottom half and steer the train accordingly to avoid oncoming missiles and trains.

Having to multi-task in such a manner, particularly at such high speeds, makes the game incredibly challenging; the goal of reaching 100,000 points is quite a challenge to reach. In fact, I die on a number of occasions, usually because everything happens at once!

I owned this back on my real C64, but I was too young to work out what was going on and didn't play it for more than a couple of minutes at a time.

One thing that I didn't realise was that if you pick up 50 missiles then your train explodes. This is why you can hear the alarm sounding for the first 2/3 of the video until I realised what was going on!

The one criticism I have about the game is the way some of the enemy trains can sometimes spawn directly on top of your own train, killing you instantly without a chance to react. This usually happens inside of tunnels, but fortunately not that often in other locations.

The has some decent graphics and a simple, yet catchy background music tune. All things considered, this was a pretty good game, especially for it's time!

Enjoy!
#retrogaming
